# Week 2 Migration Guide - Domain Layer Refactoring

## Overview

Week 2 of the refactoring initiative introduces a **Domain Layer** following Domain-Driven Design (DDD) principles. This guide helps you migrate code to use the new domain layer structure with **zero breaking changes** through compatibility layers.

## What Changed?

### 1. New Domain Layer Structure

The new domain package structure:
- domain/entities/ - Domain entities (future)
- domain/value_objects/ - Immutable value objects (types.py, port.py)
- domain/services/ - Domain services (future)
- domain/repositories/ - Repository interfaces (future)

### 2. Moved Components

| Component | Old Location | New Location |
|-----------|-------------|--------------|
| All types and enums | casare_rpa.core.types | casare_rpa.domain.value_objects.types |
| Port class | casare_rpa.core.base_node.Port | casare_rpa.domain.value_objects.port.Port |

### 3. Compatibility Layers

The following modules now act as compatibility layers that re-export from the domain layer:
- casare_rpa.core.types - re-exports from domain.value_objects.types
- casare_rpa.core.__init__ - re-exports Port from domain layer

## Import Path Changes

### Type Definitions and Enums

**OLD (deprecated, will be removed in v3.0):**
\`\`\`python
from casare_rpa.core.types import DataType, NodeId, PortId, NodeStatus
\`\`\`

**NEW (recommended):**
\`\`\`python
from casare_rpa.domain.value_objects.types import DataType, NodeId, PortId, NodeStatus
\`\`\`

### Port Value Object

**OLD (deprecated):**
\`\`\`python
from casare_rpa.core.base_node import Port
from casare_rpa.core import Port
\`\`\`

**NEW (recommended):**
\`\`\`python
from casare_rpa.domain.value_objects import Port
from casare_rpa.domain.value_objects.port import Port
\`\`\`

## Testing Your Migration

### Verify New Imports Work

\`\`\`python
from casare_rpa.domain.value_objects.types import DataType, NodeId, ExecutionResult
from casare_rpa.domain.value_objects import Port
print(''Domain imports work!'')
\`\`\`

### Verify Old Imports Still Work (with warnings)

\`\`\`python
from casare_rpa.core.types import DataType
from casare_rpa.core import Port
print(''Compatibility layer works!'')
\`\`\`

### Run Tests

\`\`\`bash
# Suppress deprecation warnings
pytest tests/ -v -W ignore::DeprecationWarning

# See where warnings occur
pytest tests/ -v -W error::DeprecationWarning
\`\`\`

## Timeline

### v2.1 (Week 2) - Current
- Domain layer introduced
- Compatibility layer active
- Deprecation warnings emitted
- Old imports still work but discouraged

### v3.0 (TBD)
- Compatibility layer REMOVED
- Old imports will FAIL
- All code must use new imports

## Questions?

Open an issue with the refactoring label.
